text: have you found yourself waiting for the
work to get done you know you have to do
it but your body just can't seem to do
it you might even get upset with

it still isn't done you have to be lazy
right well we're here to tell you that
it might not be what you think and it's
actually quite common you might not be
lazy maybe you're just over stimulated
number one biology with psychology you
might secrete slightly more adrenaline
than most people
if this is the case even the smallest
amount of over stimulation will affect
your performance if you prefer quiet
calm environments generally it could be
harder to work in a fast-paced busy
environment trying to get your homework
done or complete tasks in a chaotic
house might seem impossible to you but
other people might have no problem at
all underlying psychological differences
generalized anxiety ADHD PTSD and autism
can all make you sensitive to over
stimulation if you have one of these
conditions you might find focusing
extremely difficult you might get
distracted easily and building up the
world to do something takes a lot of
effort anxiety ADHD and autism are all
vastly different on their own but a
person can have two or more of them they
affect how we focus on tasks differently
and need to be managed differently if
you think you may have a psychological
condition that is affecting your
concentration ation we recommend seeing
a professional to find ways to treat it
that are appropriate for you
specifically you are seeking
distractions you might not think you're
looking for distractions people always
tend to gravitate towards what is easy
or fun rather than what is difficult if
you find yourself struggling to
concentrate consider what you spend your
time doing instead of the tasks you
should be doing if you know you get
distracted by social media or talk
yourself into gaming breaks find ways to
separate your from distractions working
in a comfortable private space like your
bedroom could make you far more
vulnerable to distractions a change in
scenery could be the exact change that
you need you have too much to do
sometimes the problem isn't that we have
too many distractions but rather that we
have too much work when we are presented
with too many tasks we sometimes fall
victim to a phenomenon called analysis
paralysis catchy name right this is what
happens when we can't seem to do
anything either because we are
overthinking or overanalyzing and
therefore can't make a decision or
because there is too much to do so we
can't decide where to begin because of
this we end up doing nothing for a long
time so if you have multiple tests to
study for or multiple projects to
complete and you end up studying nothing
or not doing any of your projects you
might want to find a way to prioritize
each task and do them in order even if
that order is completely random have you
been been frustrated with yourself
lately for struggling to get things down
